p: Previous investigations have reported the antimicrobial activity of Asteraceae species against bacterial pathogens. Compounds like humulene, isohumullene, caryophyllene, and germacrene- d, among others, have shown bacterial and fungal growth inhibition. Since preventing recurrent bacterial infections and improving patientsâ€™ quality of life have been the goals of many research groups, natural products with potential antimicrobial activity might be considered as a viable alternative for the effective treatment of diseases that are caused by these microorganisms [ 31, 32, 33].
